result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brian S Solberg in court.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Brian S Solberg.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court.  Motion to modify bond by Attorney Rasmussen.  No contact procedure done by victim and defendant.  Victim would like no contact lifted.  State objects.  Bond modified to no violent contact.  Not guilty plea entered by counsel.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions

**AMENDED 09-21-2022 - No violent contact with L.P.S. dob 12-25-1960. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2500 CASH (posted 07-29-2022).

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.P.S. dob 12-25-1960 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Brian S Solberg in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for bond purposes only. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Bond set, $10000 signature with $2500 cash component. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
